news uk-news meghan-markle-called-father-daddy-"Meghan and Harry: Palace wary of use of titles in US politicsBySian HarrisonJess Glass:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov Meghan Markle called her father daddy in a letter to pull on peopleaposs heartstringsit was leaked, itaposs claimed.The Duchess of Sussex told a former aide a handwritten letter to her estranged father was drafted with the understanding that it could be leaked, the Court of Appeal has heard. Jason Knauf, who was communications secretary to Meghan and Harry until March , said the duchess had indicated to him in August of the previous year that she recognised it was possible that her father, Thomas Markle, would make the letter public.Mr Knauf said in his written evidence: She also asked a specic question regarding addressing Mr Markle as aposdaddyapos in the letter, saying aposgiven Iaposve only ever called him daddy it may make sense to open as such , and in the unfortunate event that it leaked it would pull at the heartstringsapos. Mr Knauf said Meghan had deliberately ended each page part way through a sentence so that no page could be ly presented as the end of the letter.  In the event that it was leaked she wanted the full narrative as set out in the letter to be understood and shared, he continued. He added: She said she felt aposfantasticapos after writing it and added that aposAndhe leaks it then thataposs on his consciousbut at least the world will know the truth. Words I could never voice publiclyapos. Mr Knaufaposs explosive new evidence was revealed on Wednesday during the second day of an appeal by the publisher of the Mail On Sunday against a High Court judgeaposs decision that the publication of the letter was unlawful. Lawyers for Associated Newspapers Limitedtold senior judges on Tuesday that they want to rely on a recent witness statement made by Mr Knauf in their legal bid to overturn the ruling. In his statement, Mr Knauf said the duchess had lost confidence that the privacy of her communication with her father would be respected by him as a result of his increasing co-operation with reporters and photographers.  He said that, in a series of text messages sent to him by Meghan, she had written that the catalyst for writing the letter to Mr Markle, , was seeing how much pain this is causing H. Mr Knauf also said the duchess told him she was writing the letter in part to allow the duke to demonstrate to his family that some action was being taken by the couple to stop Mr Markle from continuing to engage with the media. He said the texts included an early draft of the letter and that Meghan had written: Obviously everything I have drafted is with the understanding that it could be leaked so I have been meticulous in my word choice, but please do let me knowanything stands out for you as a liability. He added: On the specic issue of the letter, the duchess indicated in messages to me that she recognised that it was possible that Mr Markle would make the letter public. She wanted to write a letter rather than an email or text message - other options she had considered and discussed with senior Royal Household staff - as a letter could not be forwarded or cut and pasted to only share one small portion.  As part of a series of messages on  August , she explained that she had given careful thought to how to prevent the letter being leaked in part or in a misleading way. In the event that it was leaked she wanted the full narrative as set out in the letter to be understood and shared. She said she had apostoiled over every detail which could be manipulatedapos. Andrew Caldecott QC, representing ANL, told the Court of Appeal: The picture presented to the judge on behalf of the claimant ... was that this was an entirely private letter crafted for Mr Markleaposs eyes only. The barrister said the High Court judge had clearly taken this into account during his ruling on privacy. He later added: The position we now have is a dferent position and a more nuanced one, that the letter was written and crafted with readership in mind, and indeed she was happy for the public to read itMr Markle were to leak it. Meghanaposs lawyers are opposing the appeal and ANLaposs bid for the Court of Appeal to take Mr Knaufaposs evidence into consideration as part of the challenge, and the duchess has provided her own statement in response. In it, she said she had decided to write the letter after discussions with unnamed senior members of the royal family, which Mr Knauf was not privy to. She said she did not think her father would leak the letter, as it would show him in a bad light. Rebutting Mr Knaufaposs evidence, she said: The proposition that saying that I recognised that it was possible that my father would leak the letter, albeit unlikely, is the same as saying that I thought it likely that he would do so is, I would suggest, absurd. Meghan also said she was eager to please the royal family and was especially sensitive to their concerns about her fatheraposs public attacks on them. She added: It is correct that, as I said in my texts to Mr Knauf, the situation was putting signicant pressure on my husband, both externally and by his family, and I felt strongly that I needed to do something about it. I felt that, evenmy attempt to stop my father talking to the media failed, at least my husband would be able to say to his family that I had done everything I could to stop it. The duchess also said the letter was the only viable option for communicating with her father, which would not have been the case before the media intrusion into their relationship.  The statements were disclosed to the press following representations to the court by the PA news agency. Meghan, , sued ANL, which is also the publisher of MailOnline, over a series of articles which reproduced parts of a personal and private letter to Mr Markle in August . She claimed the five articles, published in print and online in February , misused her private information, infringed herand breached the Data Protection Act. She won her case earlier this year after Lord Justice Warby ruled that ANLaposs publication of her letter to her father was manestly excessive and hence unlawful in a summary judgment - avoiding the need for a trial. In March, the publisher was ordered to print a statement on the front page of the Mail On Sunday and a notice on page three of the paper stating it infringed herby publishing parts of the letter to Mr Markle. But the front-page statement about Meghanaposs victory has not yet been published as it is on hold pending the outcome of the appeal. The judge concluded he could make the rulings without the need for a full trial of the issues involved. The publisheraposs appeal is being heard by Sir Geoffrey Vos, Dame Victoria Sharp and Lord Justice Bean over three days, and the judges are expected to give their ruling at a later date.Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Meghan Markle" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news meghan-markle-harrys-private-texts-"Meghan Markle being very clever with brand says hostByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov  A former aide of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle has said private messages from the pair suggested he let the authors of a bombshell biography know what they had been through”, a court has heard. The couple’s former communications secretary Jason Knauf alleges Harry and Meghan authorised “specic co-operation” on certain topics with Finding Freedom authors Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand.The biography, published in August , detailed the married lives of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex - and their infamous split from the Royal Family.The book was described as an unauthorised biography, and the royal couple have previously said they were not interviewed and did not contribute to Finding Freedom. However within the book, the authors said they did speak to the couple when appropriate.In a witness statement to the Court of Appeal today, Knauf says he met with both authors Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand in December .  In his statement, Knauf said: “I also told him [Harry] that I would meet the authors that week to help with aposfactual accuracy and context’. “The Duke replied the same day saying: apos…I totally agree that we have to be able to say we didn’t have anything to do with it. Equally, you giving the right context and background to them would help get some truths out there. “The truth is v much needed and would be appreciated, especially around the Markle wedding stuff but at the same time we can’t put them directly in touch with her friends.” The court also heard Harry contacted Knauf asking: “are u planning on giving them a rough idea of what she’s been through over the last yrs   “Media onslaught, cyber bullying on a dferent scale, puppeteering Thomas Markle etc etc etc. “Eventhey choose not to use it, they should hear what it was like from someone who was in the thick of it. “Soyou aren’t planning on telling them, can I  !” Among the subjects that Knauf says he was asked to address with the authors was the planning of their wedding and their charity work. At the time of publication, Meghan and Harryaposs team released a statement reading: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex were not interviewed and did not contribute to Finding Freedom. This book is based on the authorsapos own experiences as members of the royal press corps and their own independent reporting. Writing in the authorsapos section of the book, Scobie and Durand say: We have spoken with close friends of Harry and Meghan, royal aides and palace staff , the charities and organisations they have built long-lasting relationships with and, when appropriate, the couple themselves.  In many instances, we have granted sources anonymity to allow freedom to candidly provide direct quotes without their names being attributed .Knaufaposs statement comes after the Court of Appeal earlier heard Meghan’s letter to her estranged fatherThomas Marklewas written with public consumption in mind as a possibility.Lawyers for the Mail On Sundayaposs publisher told senior judges they want to rely on new evidence from Knauf, which suggests Meghan suspected her father may disclose the letter to the media. The newspaperaposs publisher, Associated Newspapers Limited , began its appeal on Tuesday against a High Court judgeaposs decision that the publication of the letter was unlawful. Meghan, , sued ANL, which is also the publisher of MailOnline, over a series of articles which reproduced parts of a personal and private letter to Mr Markle, , in August . She claimed the five articles, published in print and online in February , misused her private information, infringed herand breached the Data Protection Act. Meghan won her case earlier this year after Lord Justice Warby ruled that ANLaposs publication of Meghanaposs letter to her father was manestly excessive and hence unlawful in a summary judgment - avoiding the need for a trial. However, at the outset of ANLaposs challenge, due to be heard over three days, Andrew Caldecott QC, representing the publisher, said Mr Knaufaposs evidence casts doubt on the basis of the judgeaposs ruling. The publisheraposs appeal is being heard by Sir Geoffrey Vos, Dame Victoria Sharp and Lord Justice Bean over three days, and the judges are expected to give their ruling at a later date. title: meghan markle praises prince harry
story: Meghan Markle praises Prince Harry for telling her quote made famous by Spider-ManMeghan Markle has heaped praise on her husband Prince Harry and his view on being privileged with his saying on the issue almost identical to a quote made famous by Spider-ManMeghan Markle speaking at an online summitByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Nov | commentsMeghan Markle has praised husband Prince Harry’s saying on being privileged - and it’s almost identical to a quote made famous by Spider-Man. Yesterday, Meghan gave a wide-ranging interview - her first in-person since her bombshell chat with Oprah Winfrey - when she appeared at an online summit hosted by the New York Times.In it, she talked about social media, stepping back from the royal family, and her recent calls for paid leave to be made available to those in the US. In the chat, host Andrew Ross Sorkin asked Meghan why she wanted to lobby senators on the issue of paid leave after making several calls and sending an open letter to Congress.  He said: Iaposm sure there are people in the audience who are saying, aposI donapost understand - she has this great privilege, why is this her topic apos And Meghan replied: Youaposve mentioned privilege. My husband always says, aposWith great privilege comes great responsibilityapos. But even before I had any privilege in my le, when my le and my lestyle were very, very dferent, I always just stood up for what was right. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. And Harryaposs quote on privilege almost mirrors one made famous by Spider-Man, who is known for saying: With great power comes great responsibility.Elsewhere in the chat, Meghan also addressed accusations she has used her royal title to call for paid maternity leave, by introducing herself as the Duchess of Sussex when cold-calling senators to lobby them.She said: I donapost see this as a political issue frankly. There is a precedent among my husbandaposs family, the royal family, of not having any involvement in politics. From my standpoint, this is a humanitarian issue. My husband has always said with great privilege comes great responsibility and before I had any kind of privilege, I always stood up for what was right. Iaposve been gone from the US for a really long time, I was in Canada for seven years then I went to the UK. Iaposve come back and Iaposm a mother of two.  She added that lawmakers were often apossurprisedapos to hear from her but were receptive. She said: I still see myself as the same as I have always been. Iaposve always been a hard worker, people that know me well some of whom are here today know that, Iaposve just always been the same. Meghan, who sported an all-black outfit, wore a Remembrance poppy as she was questioned at the summit.She also spoke about social media and highlighted the fact that Instagram has a like button and ability to comment, but not a aposdislikeapos option. As a consequence, people either express their approval by hitting aposlikeapos, or explain their negative feelings in the comments. A aposdislikeapos button would lead to less negative, angry comments, Meghan said. Her appearance at the summit came on the same day Harry spoke at an event on misinformation on the internet hosted by Wired magazine.In it he slammed the term Megxit as misogynistic and called misinformation online a global humanitarian crisis.He also said that he and Meghan would not set up new social media accounts until tech firms take action against internet trolls. title: mum evicted 15000 beach hut
story: Mum evicted from £, beach hut by jealous neighbours after parking and toilet rowMichele Spicer bought the hut at Goring-by-Sea, West Sussex, in  to have as a place to go to for her mental health her orce - but claims she was evicted after her bully neighbours complainedMichele Spicer claims she was evicted from her beach hut amid a row with neighbours over where she could park Image: Robin Lloyd Williams   SWNSByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Nov | comments A retired teacher is fuming after she was evicted from her £, beach hut amid a row over parking, dog poo and loos.Michele Spicer bought the hut at Goring-by-Sea, West Sussex, in  to have a relaxing mermaid haven. However, the mum-of-two claims things have soured after allegations of antisocial behaviour by neighbours. Michele parked her Mercedes in a private car park, which prompted locals to leave notes and dog poo, she has claimed. She further claimed they objected to her wanting a closed public toilet to re-open as well as where she parked her car because they were “jealous of her”.  Michele claims that last month, Worthing Borough Council stepped in and removed her hut and changed the locks. The council said it was the first seafront eviction in  years. Michele said: “I went to the beach hut one morning a few weeks ago and the locks were changed - then it was removed without my knowledge. I am just a beach hut owner quietly enjoying the area because itaposs good for my mental health - but neighbours started bullying me and conspiring against me. I donapost think there is anything wrong with my parking - and I only tried to get a toilet re-opened. I did nothing but good for the community - but theyaposre jealous of me because Iaposm glamorous. It feels like this has ruined my le - Iaposve lost my beloved beach hut. Michele bought the beach hut in April  to create a haven for herself and her mental health following her orce. She said she spent months renovating it and claims it is now worth £,. She said abusive notes were left on her car windscreen following her campaign to have a toilet re-opened near to the row of beach huts. Residents of a nearby development have to pay a service charge for the upkeep of the toilet, despite it being on council-owned land. She claims they rejected her request to re-open the toilet. Michele also says she was left notes on her car that called her an idiot and told her she was p***ing residents off, although she claims she is entitled to park where she did. She said: I didnapost do anything wrong - but because I model and I have a nice car, they have a certain impression of me. Her neighbours eventually reported her to Worthing Borough Council for antisocial behaviour, she claims. And when she went to visit the hut on October , she found the locks had been changed before it was later removed from its spot entirely, she said. She says it had been moved to the front of the sailing club - with all her belongings still inside. She said: I had a full breakdown on the beach when I couldnapost find it.  When I did, I found it had been damaged beyond repair and all my belongings were still inside. My pride and joy were taken without me even knowing about it. She said she camped for several days near the beach hut because she was scared of it being taken away again. Michele said she wants it moved to her garden in Worthing and wonapost give up until she gets justice, and sheaposs taking legal action against the council.  Michele said: Honestly itaposs ruined my le - Iaposve experienced a hell of a lot of stress. Iaposm just a normal beach hut owner - I come to the beach for a walk for my mental health and Iaposm sociable with the other owners. Iaposve done nothing wrong - itaposs a conspiracy against me to get me removed. I think itaposs because theyaposre jealous of me because Iaposm a model and Iaposm very glamorous with a sports car. But all Iaposve done is be a good resident and try to stand up for people. I wanted the hut to improve my mental health but itaposs just been  months of total misery. The hut is my le and my little haven - and I just want it back where it belongs. A spokesperson for Worthing Borough Council said: We are sorry it has come to this but for the first time in about  years we have had to take eviction action at one of our beach huts. The number of complaints received from local residents really left us with no choice but to conclude that Mrs Spicer has breached the terms of her lease. title: my half siblings reached out
story: "My half siblings reached out to me after our dads death but I ignored them"A woman asked the Reddit thread ‘AITA’she was wrong for ignoring her half siblings after her dads death - the internet had opinionsThe woman decided to ignore her half sibling sisters after her dads death [stock image] Image: GettyByEmily Sleight:,  Nov | commentsA woman who ignored her half siblings after the death of their father has received plenty of support from the people of the internet.Asking for some opinions on the Reddit thread AITA - which stands for “am I the a*****e”, the woman described her dad as “absent” in her le, and wanted to know whether it was wrong of her to ignore her half siblings after his death. She explained: “I feel like I should clary that I was in high school when this happened so I was directly impacted by my dad leaving.“He went from living with us and being a regular part of my le to barely speaking with me because his new we wanted him to forget his first family.”The woman said that he also failed to pay child support because his new we didn’t want him to spend money on them.She continued: “I have zero interactions with his second we. I have spoken to her exactly two times in my le, when he died at the hospital and his funeral.“She seems like she’s a decent parent but I am not willing to develop any sort of relationship with her, even for the sake of my half sisters.”The -year-old woman is older than her two half siblings, who are  and -years-old.She said: “We shared a dad, who left my mum after cheating on her for their mum.“It was a terrible orce and my dad was basically an absent father after he abandoned us.“My relationship with my dad and his kids was not close and I would only see them a few times a yearthat.That was until her father was diagnosed with lung cancer last year, and died within six months.She continued: During that time, I ended up spending more time with him and we became very close again towards the end of his le.“I still think he did a terrible thing, but I finally forgave him before he died.”Since his death, the two half siblings have reached out to the woman a few times but she has ignored them.“They are making me feel very guilty and point blank asked me why I don’t love them.“Of course I denied it, but she’s not really wrong. I have nothing against them, but I feel nothing for them beyond a general desire to make sure they aren’t in danger.“If they needed my help financially, I would help out, but I really don’t want to be in their lives regularly. It drags up all sorts of negative feelings from my past that I’ve struggled to overcome.”She concluded: “So, AITA for basically ignoring two innocent kids who recently lost their dad and just want their sister to love them  Because I sure do feel like one.”Here is an AITA key for reference: Youaposre the a** hole YTAYouaposre Not the a** hole NTA Everyone sucks here  ESH No a** holes here  NAHIt would seem that the most common response amongst Reddit users was NAH, which stands for “no a** holes here.”One Reddit user responded to the thread: “Iaposm not sure how to vote on this one, but Iaposm going to say NAH.“You have entirely valid feelings, but so do they. I think you should let them know that youaposll always be there for themthey need anything, whether financially or for advice, but youaposd really like to grieve alone for now.”Another added: “NAH. “They may not like it but youaposre not obligated to have a relationship with them. Forcing the issue is only going to hurt them in the long run.”Some were a little harsher than others, with one user responding: “NTA. The last link to them is gone. You owe them nothing.” Do you agree with the internet, or was this woman in the wrong for her choices For funeral notices in your area visit funeral-notices Comment MORE ON RedditEducationFuneralsHospitalsLoveLung cancerSecondary schoolFrisk" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: passport egate outage sparks travel
story: Passport eGate outage sparks travel chaos at UK airports with two-hour queuesThe Home Office said it was aware of a "technical issue" and apologised to all passengers affected, with problems reported at Heathrow, Luton and StanstedPassport e-gates at Heathrow failed for the third time in as many months this morning Image: @thetimes TwitterByJonathan ColesReporter:,  Nov | commentsAn eGate outage at airports across southern Britain has sparked travel chaos - with passengers reporting two-hour queues. Photographs posted on social media on Wednesday showed y lines at Heathrow, Luton and Stansted. It is the third time the eGates - which were first implemented in  - have gone down in as many months. The Home Office, which manages the self-service barriers, apologised to all travellers who had been affected. But the problem has still drawn the ire of some passengers, who took to social media. One described the situation at Heathrow as a complete shower, and added that there did not appear to be staff around to help.Have you been affected by the issue  Email webnews@mirror.Another, Bloomberg reporter Sid Philip, said: Another day, another outage at Heathrow.  hours from plane to outside the terminal and I was lucky! The bizarre bit was for about ten minutes none of the counters were manned as the agents laughed, stood up and left! And musician Edward Grint posted: Stansted or Standstill  Landed nearly an hour ago. Looks like it’s going to be well over  hours waiting for someone to check my forms.Paul Knights - who said he had been stuck at Luton Airport since .am - told MailOnline : Someone has come up and down the queue, theyaposve said itaposs a national outage at border control. The official came up once or twice in this massive queue. Iaposd say thereaposs probably another hour to go. People are patient here, thereaposs no ranting and raving. Itaposs generally quite calm.Meanwhile, a Heathrow worker told The Times : I came onto sht and they were working.Then they just failed and all weaposve been told is there is a technical issue. Itaposs becoming a real issue. There are more than  eGates across  air and rail ports in Britain, according to the government website. But the barriers also failed at airports and ports nationwide on September  and October  this year - and were closed for weeks when foreign leisure travel resumed on May . There have also reportedly been staffing issues at the UK Border Force after being in close contact with someone who tested positive for Covid-. Commenting on Wednesdayaposs issue, a Home Office spokesperson said: We are aware of a technical issue affecting eGates at a number of ports. We are working to resolve the issue as soon as possible and apologise to all passengers for the inconvenience caused. E-gates are used to process the vast majority of British and European arrivals. They are also able to process arrivals from the US, Canada, Australia and Japan. news uk-news royals-set-major-title-changes-"Lilibet Diana: Nicholl discusses possible royal titleByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Nov | commentsNot content with being given simple names like the rest of us, the royals are often given grand titles. But these titles arenapost always kept forever - they can be ever-changing as they navigate royal le. For example, Lady Louise Windsor who turned  yesterday, does not use an HRH or princess title - even though she is entitled to. But now sheaposs an adult, she could well decide to adopt these stylesshe wants to. And sheaposs not the only royal who could see their titles change in the future. We take a look.... Prince WilliamOn his wedding day in , Prince William was granted the title of Duke of Cambridge. But once his father Prince Charles ascends to the throne, he will be known as something  as well.Thataposs because he will inherit Charlesaposs current title Prince of Wales - which is reserved for the male heir to the throne.Not only that, he will also become the Duke of Cornwall, Duke of Rothesay when in Scotland and Earl of Chester.Kate Middleton  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. The Duchess of Cambridge was also granted her grand title on her wedding day - the same as her husband Prince William.And when his titles change when Charles becomes King - so will hers.As William will become Prince of Wales, Kate will be entitled to be the Princess of Wales - a title previously held by her late mother-in-law Princess Diana.She will also take the female version of his other future titles, meaning she will also be Duchess of Cornwall, Duchess of Rothesay and Countess of Chester.And when William eventually ascends to the throne, she will become Queen consort, meaning she will probably become Queen Catherine - Catherine being her real first name.Prince George He may only be eight but Prince George is third in line to the throne and could see numerous title changes over his letime.His current title is Prince George of Cambridge but when his parents become Prince and Princess of Wales - he will then become known as Prince George of Wales. Then when his parents become King and Queen, as the male heir he would become Prince of Wales.Thataposs also not to mention the fact he will also be probably given a dukedom on his wedding dayhe chooses to marry.Princess Charlotte Like her big brother Prince George, Princess Charlotte is also set for some dramatic title changes.She too is known a Princess Charlotte of Cambridge but will change to become Princess Charlotte of Wales when her dad becomes Prince of Wales.Meanwhile, when William becomes King, he could choose to give her the title of Princess Royal, which is usually awarded to the oldest daughter of the monarch. However, as it is a title that remains for le, Charlotte could only be awarded it once the current Princess Royal, Princess Anne, passes away. Duchess of Cornwall There have long been reports that Prince Charles plans to mix things up and slim down the monarchy when he becomes King.And one way he could do this is by giving his we Camilla, the Duchess of Cornwall, an unprecedented title when he ascends the throne.Usually, the we of a King uses the title of Queen Consort and ever since they went public with their relationship there has been much discussion about the role his second we will take when the Queen passes away.But at the time of their marriage in , an official statement said it is intended that The Duchess will be known as HRH The Princess Consort”.This would make Camilla the first British royal to ever use the title of Princess Consort.Archie and Lilibet Prince Harry and Meghan Markleaposs young children Archie and Lilibet currently do not hold titles or the HRH style.But when their grandfather Prince Charles becomes King, they could well be entitled to them.A spokesperson for Debrettaposs told the Mirror: In , King George V ordered that only the grandchildren of the monarch would be entitled to use the style of prince or princess and HRH, the only exception to this order was that the eldest son of the eldest son of the Prince of Wales would also be entitled to be use the style HRH and Prince.“In , the Queen issued new Letters Patent that the style of HRH and Prince Princess would be extended to all of Prince William’s children, not just his eldest son.“Archieaposs entitlement to use the style of Prince and HRH will come into force when his grandfather Prince Charles becomes King.”Prince Edward and Sophie WessexInstead of being made a duke, Prince Edward was made Earl of Wessex when he married his we Sophie in .However, he is set to eventually get the title of a duke - although it will be when his older brother Charles becomes King. And that the title will be Duke of Edinburgh.It was announced at the time of Edwardaposs wedding he would one day succeed his father as the Duke of Edinburgh with the blessing of the late Prince Philip and the Queen.Sophie, currently the Countess of Wessex, will eventually become the Duchess of Edinburgh - a courtesy title which was held by the Queen - when that happens.Comment MORE ON Kate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgeLady Louise WindsorPrince WilliamRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: spooky glow over city leaves
story: Spooky glow over city leaves residents baffled but has simple explanationThe strange fluorescent cloud, which was spotted by many in the Longford, Aldermans Green and Foleshill areas of Coventry on Monday evening had some wondering about UFOs Image: Martin Garry, Bird in HandByDanny ThompsonFlorence Freeman:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments A mysterious glow that lit up parts of Coventry this week, which left confused residents wondering about possible UFO s, has been explained. According to Coventry Live, the strange fluorescent cloud, which was spotted by many in the Longford, Aldermans Green and Foleshill areas on Monday evening, had first appeared to be the work of aliens.Many, like local resident Martin Garry, had noticed the ghostly gleams while out walking. He said: I noticed it while walking the dog in the park. I thought it looked a bit strange. I was curious, being an amateur astronomer, so I grabbed a picture. He added: I hadn’t seen anything like it before for sure. I did have mixed thoughts as it was by the stadiumbut seemed a strange colour for the lights. So my thoughts went to a type of Northern Lights, which Iaposve not seen before. Who knows, maybe the Lord was shining on the mighty Sky Blues, passing on ine intervention for last-minute goals and their journey to the promised land!  But Adele Walsh, who was at the Arena Shopping Park, had noticed the lights and recognised the source appearing from the Coventry Building Society Arena. Adele said: I thought it looked quite spooky, but there was like drizzly rain too so the air was quite misty which made it look even brighter. However, Coventry Live has revealed the mysterious glow was in fact not the work of aliens, but the work of the grounds team at the arena. The articial sunlight used on the arena pitch help to grow and repair the pitch after it is played on. The lights were previously announced in a “joint investment” made by the club and rugby club Wasps in an “effort to keep the pitch healthy”. Chief executive of the Football, Dave Boddy said: “We are jointly investing in another set of growing lights which, as you can see are on the pitch now, so there will be a second set of lights in situ and it will be very much a collaborative situation where we work very closely together.” For now, it seems any visit from extraterrestrials in Coventry is unlikely - just yet.Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON UFOs" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: super fit nurse who lost
story: Super-fit nurse who lost arm and both her legs to sepsis found hanged by husbandJayne Carpenter, , whose independence had been "stripped overnight," was left with just one limb when she developed sepsis four years ago while suffering with what she thought was a simple coughJayne Carpenter, , with her husband Rob,  Image: WALES NEWS SERVICEByLeigh Mcmanus:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov  A brave nurse who lost both her legs and an arm after a simple cough turned to sepsis was found hanged by her husband after the implications of the disease challenged her desire to live, an inquest heard.Keen traveller Jayne Carpenter, , whose independence had been stripped overnight, was left with just one limb when she developed sepsis four years ago while suffering with what she thought was a simple cough. In , she developed sepsis after going to the doctor with a cough. In hospital, she was diagnosed with pneumonia and sepsis and spent two months in a coma.Courageous Jayne vowed to battle on by fundraising to get pioneering limb surgery not available on the NHS and she had raised over £, of her £, target, but said she was not having quality of le but enduring it.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here An inquest heard her heartbroken husband Rob, , got a call from Jayne asking to pick up their dog and when he arrived at the house in Merthyr Tydfil, South Wales, at .pm, he found her hanged. Jayne was described as an amazing person by Robert at the inquest. He said: The brightest star in my sky has burnt out. In a statement to the inquest, he said she was happy, bubbly, sociable person who had a passion for travelling around the world when they first met. After her amputations, Mr Carpenter said his we put all her effort into regaining her le and she amazed us as a family. He said that, as a sepsis awareness advocate, her experiences were used to assist the education of medical students. But, in November , he noticed a sudden decline in Jaynes mental health and she began drinking more alcohol, he said. The inquest heard she twice took an overdose - and the restrictions of the coronavirus pandemic stopped her from enjoying the things that were important to her.On the day she died in December , tests showed she had drunk a large quantity of alcohol but police did not find a note stating her intention to take her own le. Assistant Coroner for South Wales Central, Dr Sarah-Jane Richards, said undoubtedly, her loss of limbs inflicted a le-changing loss to this previously healthy and active woman. She added that her death was in the context of traumatic, le-changing events having challenged her desire to live. A coroner concluded a narrative verdict at the Merthyr inquest that Jayne died by self ligature in circumstances where her intention could not be discerned. news uk-news teacher-who-kicked-horse-shocking-"Leicestershire: Woman seen appearing to kick a horseByJonathan ColesReporter:,  Nov A teacher accused of kicking and slapping a horse has fled her home after death threats were made against her, it is claimed. Sarah Moulds, , is said to have left Melton Mowbray in Leicestershire to get away from the vile abuse, a neighbour said. The RSPCA is probing footage of the alleged incident, which was shared by an anti-hunting group on Facebook. Leicestershire Police also confirmed to the Mirror that it had been made aware of the video - and would assist the RSPCA investigationneeded. The shocking recording shows a girl appearing to lose control of a horse while leading it into a horse box. A woman then grabs its tether before kicking it and slapping its head at least four times.Do you know Ms Moulds  Do you know what happened  Email webnews@mirror. The clip - said to have been filmed on Saturday - has racked up more than two million views. Ms Moulds has since been suspended from her teaching job while investigations take place - and has now reportedly gone into hiding.A fellow rider told MailOnline : Sheaposs had to go away after receiving death threats and loads of vile abuse.Itaposs awful and has got very much out of hand. She fears for her le. She has young children and she is worried about them as well as herself.  The RSPCA has not confirmed the identity of the huntswoman but said the footage was really upsetting. We will always look into complaints made to us about animal welfare, a statement added. The welfare group has also left a calling card at married mum-of-two Ms Mouldsapos home, asking her to get in touch. Leicestershire Police said on Wednesday that it would take action -necessary. We have been made aware of a video on social media in relation to a report of animal cruelty, the force said. The RSPCA is leading on this investigation and Leicestershire Police will assist and support the investigation as required. Ms Moulds has been suspended from her teaching job at Somerby Primary School, the trust which runs the school confirmed. Mowbray Education Trust said: We can confirm that a member of staff has been suspended pending formal investigations.The Daily Star reports that Moulds was also listed as a team manager for the local Cottesmore Pony ClubBut she has since been removed from the website following the allegations.  The Pony Club said Ms Moulds would not be continuing in her voluntary position as a team organiser for a branch. Video of the alleged incident was first shared by Hertfordshire Hunt Saboteurs. It is believed that Ms Moulds was taking part in a ride organised by the Cottesmore Hunt. The group said on Tuesday that its senior members want to make it quite clear that they strongly disapprove of any such actions. A statement added that such matters would be taken very seriously and dealt with in an appropriate manner. news uk-news tearful-owner-takes-dying-dog-"Boxer dog gets given ice cream after tumour diagnosisByBethan ShufflebothamNiche Writer:,  Nov | commentsWhen Marley’s owner discovered she didn’t have long left with the boxer-cross, she wanted to fulfil one final wish for him. The boxer labrador mix loves to howl at the ice-cream van before getting his own soft-served treat - and Katie Dixon wanted to hear him sing for ice-cream just one more time. The mum-of-two, from Staffordshire, received the heartbreaking news that Marley had cancer, and she would have to make the decision to put him to sleep in the coming weeks. Marley had been by her side for eight years - from sleeping on a friendaposs sofa, to helping her through dficult times. Katie said: “Marley was born on July , . I didnapost want a dog initially as I was living with two friends at the time, sleeping on their sofa. “But I went to see my other friend and her dogs had just had puppies. All the other pups came running over to me straight away but Marley sat up in his bed yawned and fell out of the bed, he strolled over to me slowly and lay down on my feet. I just knew from that moment that I had to have him.” The -year-old credited her ‘boxador’ for helping her through challenging times.If youaposre grieving a dog whoaposs crossed the Rainbow Bridge, leave them a tribute on TeamDogs . She added: “Marley has been my strength when I didnapost even have any. He is the best present Iaposve ever had. He’s been through all my dficult times with me and he’s truly my best friend. “It might sound silly but Iaposve told that pooch things that Iaposll take to my grave. He’s as loyal as they come. Iaposm going to be so lost without him.” Last month, Katie noticed a lump in Marley’s mouth and rushed him to the vets where they treated him for an abscess. But after two weeks, the eight-year-old dog was no better, and ed to the practice where Katie was told her dog had a tumour.  He underwent an operation to remove as much as they could, but  days later, the fast-growing tumour had ed. Katie added: “He hasnapost been himself since Saturday - he’s really lethargic and not wanting to eat or drink. I took him back to the vets again and they said the tumour is already back and thereaposs nothing more that can be done for him. “The tumour is fast growing and seems to be taking its toll quickly. Iaposll have to make a decision soon as heaposs in pain and chewing his fur off his tail.”One of Katie’s favourite things about Marley is how he howls at the jingle of an ice cream van, and she took to Facebook to seeanyone would be able to drive by their home to give him one last cone.  TeamDogs is a community for dog lovers who want to get the most out of their relationship with their best pal. Make sharing the cutest photos of your dog your first job on the website and after youaposve done that, leave a tip to help fellow dog owners live their best lives as a proud pooch parent. Search through hundreds of recommended walks, treats, toys and places to stay when youaposre on an adventure together. From dog-friendly pubs to product reviews and the latest news, you can snf it all out at TeamDogs. Staffordshire ice cream man Jeff Condlfe took the time to go off-route to visit Marley and give him a special treat. In an emotional video, Marley hears the tune to the van and puts his paws on his garden gate to give out a melodic howl. Katie leads him over to the van where Marley puts his paws up to the counter to take an ice cream from Jeff. The boxador enjoyed not one, but four ice-cream cones surrounded by family and friends who were holding back tears. Katie said: “Thank you so much to Jeff for letting me hear that howl one last time and thank you for making my pooch a very happy boy. Marl enjoyed it with a few family and friends there to watch him. Iaposll be forever grateful.” Comment MORE ON TeamDogsIce creamAnimalsDogs" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news uk-weather-forecast-exact-date-"UK weather: Chart shows snowfall is set to strike countryByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsBrits are enjoying a mild start to November but a big freeze is on its way soon, according to forecasters. While parts of the country have been hit with showers, floods and gales over the past couple of weeks, temperatures have remained mild. It even reached an unseasonal C in Flintshire, North Wales, on Monday.But after more wind and rain from the remnants of Tropical Storm Wanda, the Met Office has said that freezing temperatures and snowfall are around the corner - starting on Sunday, November .Bookies have slashed the odds on this being the coldest November ever, from - to just -. Weather maps are showing that the risk of snow will grow next week. On Wednesday, November , there is a high possibility of snow in Scotland and then over the following day it is likely to hit the North East of England. Then the risk of snow grows down the eastern side of the UK before the map on Saturday, November  suggests most of the UK will have a very high chance of snow. The worst affected will be Scotland, northern England and the Midlands. Temperatures will have noseed to as low as -C in parts of Scotland and could be around -C in southern England on Thursday, November . It is predicted to get even colder going down to -C in southern England and -C in northern Scotland in the early hours of Sunday, November . We are headed for a big November freeze, said Coralaposs Harry Aitkenhead Itaposs left us with no choice but to signicantly slash the odds on this month entering the record books as the coldest eleventh month of the year the UK has ever seen. The Met Office said that there is likely to be a drop in temperatures at the start of next week and then again at the end of the month. It stated: “Remaining changeable and autumnal particularly to the north through the start of this period as low-pressure systems dominate, sometimes accompanied by rain and strong winds. Elsewhere while rain is possible at times, drier and brighter conditions are more likely in the south and southeast regions, although some rain will likely reach even here at times. A rather cold start to the period will likely be followed by a brief recovery in temperatures, before a further likely trend down later on in the month. Later on in the month there will also be an increasing chance of some wintry conditions, mainly over the higher ground in the north, but with a slight risk to lower levels.  Today: A few bright spells in south-east England,  central and southern areas cloudy with outbreaks of rain and drizzle and a good deal of hill fog. Northern areas having sunny spells and some showers, most in the far north. Tonight: Low cloud, mist and fog across central and southern areas with some drizzle. Clear periods further north with patchy frost and fog, but heavy showers and gales in far north. Thursday: Low cloud lting slowly, with some fog persisting until early afternoon over eastern England, then sunny spells. Showers in the north, then rain and strong winds into the northwest later. Outlook for Friday to Sunday: Breezy with outbreaks of rain on Friday, heaviest in the northwest. Over the weekend, cloudy in the east with some drizzle, brighter in the west. Mild, turning colder later. title: ways google can track you
story: All the ways Google can track you – and tips on how to prevent itSearch engine giant Google uses our information for its own purposes like tailoring advertising, but you can turn this off on your account and phone through some very simple stepsGoogle is one of many companies that tracks our data Image: Getty ImagesByBenjamin LynchSEO writer:,  Nov | comments Googleaposs technology is dficult to avoid and has been used to track many of us, but the UK Supreme Court recently ruled that the tech giant does not owe users any compensation. The court ruled in Lloyd vs Google that the legal judgement in by the Court of Appeal in  - which could have seen iPhone users receiving up to £ in compensation each - will now not take place.Most online companies track your data in some way to personalise your web experience and tailor certain things to you and we often agree to it willingly. Google is no dferent. So how do we stop Google from collecting our data  Google maps - tracking your whereabouts  Google stores the exact coordinates of where you have been on the commonly used Google Maps app. It can be a useful feature of the app in that it stores your previous trips, reminding you of where you were at one time and how you got there. But you can work against this optionyou wish to. You can stop Google Maps using your GPS location, as well as turning off your location history Make Use Of explains: The Web and App Activity switch, however, is the most critical one here. Enabling it lets Google save all of your activities on any Google product or service. This also allows Google to share your location data between its own apps to offer a more personal experience. All of these options can be turned off. To doe this, go to settings within the Google Maps app and click apospersonal contentapos. Here you will find the relevant options you need to turn off. Android users are still tracked eventhey turn off their location settings. To counteract this, disable both aposWeb  App Activityapos and aposLocation Historyapos. Your search history  This is a important one. Google tracks all of the things you search. Visit the My Activity website and switch off Web  App Activity to stop your search history being followed. You can also delete your old history here. The same goes for YouTube, just visiting apossettingsapos and then aposhistory and privacyapos. The popular browser Chrome also needs to be dealt withyou want to ensure all points are covered. Make Use Of said: To exclude Chrome history and your activity on ious sites, visit the Activity Controls page and under Web  App Activity, disable the Include Chrome history option. Useful tips  Donapost just limit Google on one device, make sure all devices you use with a certain Google account have taken preventative measures. Business Insider said: There is an important exception: In the Location History settings, you can click Devices on this account to see all the phones and tablets being tracked. You can choose to uncheck any of those devices to stop Google from tracking it. Make sure to take notice of other features on your Google account too like the aposAd personalizationapos section, which can be turned off. Google photos you can do nothing about, these are used for facial recognition. Only leaving Google will stop photos being processed. Your questions listened to by Google Assistant are also stored, but you can turn this off in activity controls also. The case against GoogleRichard Lloyd brought the case against the firm on the behalf of four million people in England and Wales, claiming that Google secretly tracked the data of millions of iPhone users on the Safari web browser between  and . Lloyd - a former director of consumer group Which  - alleged that Google gathered information on iPhone users who used the web browser and used it for advertising purposes.  The data consisted of information on peopleaposs health, race, ethnicity, sexuality and political affiliations. Google has insisted that no information was shared to third parties. The company said the data collection was accidental and the Supreme Court unanimously agreed that compensation was not owed as it was not clear that all of the iniduals suffered any material damage or distress. Lloydaposs solicitor James Oldnall, said: The ruling today gives Google and rest of Big Tech the green light to continue misusing our data without consent, knowing they will go unpunished. It is a dark day when corporate greed is valued over our right to privacy. news uk-news woman-flies-thousands-miles-surprise-"Woman flies to Dubai to surprise friend after completing cancer treatmentByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Nov | commentsA British teacher who has been battling breast cancer while living in Dubai on her own with no family support was left stunned when her best friend surprised her by taking a secret trip to visit her. Sian Moss, , was diagnosed with aggressive triple negative breast cancer just one week before her birthday in May this year. The teacher was working in the UAE, and Covid flight restrictions meant none of her family could be with her when she started chemotherapy, as Dubai was on the UK’s red list. And after the cancer treatment began to make poor Sian’s hair fall out, she was left feeling like she “couldn’t be bothered with it anymore” – until her best friend swooped in to give her a much-needed pick-me-up. Amanda Cope, , flew thousands of miles to Dubai on her own to surprise Sian as she walked out of her penultimate chemo appointment, and the shock of seeing her pal almost caused Sian to faint. In a clip posted on TikTok, Sian is seen walking out of the hospital with a huge smile on her face, before freezing and spotting her long-distance pal. The video, which has since racked up more than , views and , likes, shows the pair running into each otheraposs arms and laughing, as the shocked Sian tries not to pass out. Sian, from Ipswich, said: Amandaaposs surprise came at the best time. Iaposd had a really tough week. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Iaposd been using the cold cap to try and save my hair, but in the last week, because of the amount of chemo, my hair had been falling out and Iaposd been having really bad bone pain. That morning I woke up and thought aposI just canapost be bothered with this anymoreapos. I was in such a flat mood so when I came out and saw her, I almost fainted. I just couldnapost believe she was there. There was so much emotion. I felt instantly better. It was amazing. Sian found a lump in her right breast after a workout this year and decided to get herself checked out despite not feeling ill. And the woman says it was probably the best decision she could have made, because she managed to catch her cancer early. She added: I only found the lump back in April. It was completely by accident. By this point, the UAE was on the UKaposs red list so I didnapost really have an option to get home. I just decided to do all my treatment here. “Itaposs all gone well so far. I was very lucky because I managed to catch it at stage one and it hadnapost gone into a lymph node.  With the situation, I tell myself how lucky I am that I did get it checked and got it sorted so soon. It could have a completely dferent story within six months to a year. Sian met Amanda three years ago when they were both working in Dubai, but Amanda was made redundant during the pandemic and moved back to the UK. And when she heard about Sian’s cancer diagnosis, the woman – who now works in marketing – was keen to go back to Dubai to support her friend. She said: Sian had been going through cancer on her own so I thoughtthere was one thing I could do, it was surprise her. It worked out great and at one point, we thought she was going to pass out. I was like aposOh no, weaposve wiped her outapos, but she was fine. She was absolutely buzzing.” The pair’s TikTok video has received a wholly positive reception, and people have been sending their well wishes to Sian. Amanda added: Everyoneaposs full of well wishes for Sian and a few people have messaged her wanting to talk to her. Weaposve had loads of comments on both videos now. I think people just love a nice positive story.Have you got a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: youre not friend you use
story: "Youre not a friendyou use racist language - Gary Ballance should know that"Ex-England cricketer Gary Ballance said that he called Yorkshire county teammate, Azeem Rafiq, a “P***” – but said it was done “in the spirit of friendly banter”Gary Ballance admitted calling Azeem Rafiq a p*** Image: Getty ImagesopinionByDarren Lewis:,  Nov | commentsMost of us Black or Asian people you know will have one. The “friend” who thinks knowing us insulates them from the charge of racism when they are being just that. Ex-England cricketer Gary Ballance admitted in a statement last week he’d called Yorkshire teammate, Azeem Rafiq, a “P***” – but said it was done “in the spirit of friendly banter” . Ballance has come clean because, in August , Rafiq gave an interview in which he spoke about the racism he experienced at Yorkshire, including an “openly racist” captain and a dressing room in which racist comments were seen as humorous. The club effectively stuck its head in the sand, but an independent report has blown the whole thing wide open. Sponsors have withdrawn their cash, chairman Roger Hutton has resigned and English cricket’s most successful county has been banned from hosting internationals.  But back to Ballance. He claims to be incredulous that calling an Asian person the P-word could cause the kind of hurt and anguish it did to Rafiq. “If I’d believed it, I would have stopped immediately,” said Ballance. “He was my best cricket mate and I cared deeply for him.” Just not enough to stop using this horrendous racist slur against him. It is easy to believe this is a story just about Yorkshire, cricket or even sport. It isn’t. Go into any office, factory, shop floor or football club you like and you’ll find at least one dinosaur convinced that racist abuse can be used as a term of affection. ‘Can a racist term ever be defined as banter ’ trilled the Twitter account of the BBC’s Question Time. Yes, really. It may as well have asked whether slapping your partner is ever justied. Or whether political corruption is ever justiedthe money is for a good cause.  If ever we needed a snapshot of the institutional racism that infects this country to its core, the past week has provided it. Ironically, there is more outrage and anger directed at those who call it out - as Rafiq has found to his cost - than at the issue itself. Yet the fact remains, across any number of industries and sports, iniduals like him iniably find themselves one of the only Black or Asian people in the room at the mercy of the bigots. Across the country you’ll find iniduals pulling the emergency ripcord defence that their workmate, best friend, neighbour, partner, even husband or we is black. Asthat allows them a free pass to use the kind of language or go down the routes that would otherwise see them vilied. The Government does it even now. Prime Minister Boris Johnson surrounds himself with gatekeepers such as Kwasi Kwarteng, Kemi Badenoch and Priti Patel, believing it protects him from stick for describing Burqa-wearing women as looking like letterboxes. Or describing black people as ‘picaninnies’. Question Time is no exception. Presumably pointing to whatever black or Asian members it has on its production team. And no, it is no defence that the offensive question tweeted was one posed by an audience member to spark debate. Rafiq’s forthcoming appearance in front of a parliamentary select committee may well bring the rest of Yorkshire’s house of cards down. But the shock waves are already reverberating way beyond cricket. PS: You’re not someone’s friendyou’re using racist language towards them. title: you should stop wearing poppies
story: When you should stop wearing poppies after Remembrance Day Poppies are worn as a sign of respect and pride in every corner of the UK to honour our veterans and lives lost to war. Here’s what you need to know about the Poppy AppealPoppies are worn as a sign of respect to honour lives lost to war Image: Getty ImagesByMalvika Padin:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsEvery year when November comes around, you’re sure to see many people across the country wearing a poppy on their lapel.The poppy is a symbol of Remembrance Day which falls on November , marking the end of the First World War . Taking its origin from the  poem In Flanders Fields by Canadian officer John McCrae and later adopted as a signicant symbol of the Royal British Legion, the poppy is worn not only during Remembrance but at the funerals of veterans or even other events like memorial services or anniversaries. Worn with respect on the left side over the heart, the symbolic flower should not be affixed with any pin that obstructs the Poppy.When do you stop wearing a poppy   Typically the Poppy Appeal lasts from end of October – starting on Thursday, October  this year- till Remembrance Day on November . The poppies can be worn throughout this period but also on the evening after the Remembrance Day Ceremony. While some people choose to remove their Poppy at the end of the day on November , others remove it after the ceremony and place their poppy on the cenotaph or on a wreath as a sign of respect. How to remove and store your poppy  When a Poppy is removed, it should either be stored appropriately or disposed of respectfully. If you find a poppy that’s fallen on the ground, pick it up, brush it off so that it can be kept or disposed of. Where to buy a poppy for Remembrance Day   You can buy paper poppies from collectors on high streets, supermarkets and transport hubs. The flowers are also available for purchase online, not just in simple paper form but as badges, pins, wreaths and even alcoholic drinks. Last year, due to the pandemic, the Legion couldn’t send out volunteers to sell poppies on the street. So, people were encouraged to donate using QR codes, contactless methods and via online s. This year the collectors are back, but the alternative methods of donation are still available. news us-news im-trolled-living-tiny-house-"TikTok user discusses living in a ‘tiny’ house with kidsByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA mum who moved into a super small house has hit back at critics after they accused her of mistreating her kids by forcing them to sleep in a “closet”.TikTok mum Helena Havens, @helenahavens, and her daughter Layla moved into the tiny home after she began dating her boyfriend Mike, who has a daughter of his own named Kenzie.Mike and Kenzie already lived in the home before he met Helena, and invited the -year-old and her daughter – who is three years old, the same age as his daughter – to live with them. Helena gave fans on TikTok a tour of the miniscule property earlier this year, and showed off the master bedroom – which only just fits in a double bed – and the kitchen, which doesn’t have a full range of cooking appliances. In a separate video addressing the lack of appliances, Helena, from New Jersey, USA, said: We eat with his parents every night down at their house but up here we have a hot plate, toaster oven and microwave. The couple’s daughters share a small room which just about fits their two beds, and even though extra storage space has been created by using shelves above their beds, people still accuse Helena of forcing her kids to sleep in a wardrobe. When one viewer called her selfish for her kids’ sleeping arrangements, Helena replied: A lot of people have been concerned and wondering why we get the aposbig room’, and the kids get the aposclosetapos. “Itaposs not a closet, it was added on just for them and it fits both of their beds perfectly. It is meant for sleeping and that is all that it is really used for.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Our bedroom fits our queen bed and thataposs all, we donapost have a dresser in here, so I donapost get where you got this whole aposbig room ideaapos because we donapost have a big room. “Someone said we should sleep in the kids room but the kids room would not fit our bed. Youaposve got to work here with what youaposve got. Okay   Helena also insisted the tiny home is not her family’s forever home, and they plan on finding a bigger place as soon as they can. And while the two young girls “fight like normal siblings would” from time to time, they have no problems sharing a room. Helena insisted: They take comfort in sleeping near each other. Sometimes they fall asleep in the same bed. This is our very temporary home! We plan to find a bigger place when the time is right.Have you got a story to share  We want to hear all about it. House of Horrors alongside their  siblings said they came close to death so many times and said it was now or never when they escaped. Jordan Turpin was  when she broke free and made desperate phone call to police, explaining how her parents David and Louise Turpin beat, starved, and shackled the children to their beds at the home in Calornia. When officers responded to her desperate call for help, they initially thought Jordan was only  as she was so emaciated from years of being underfed. Now speaking out for the first time, Jordan ABC: My whole body was shaking. I couldnapost really dial . I think it was us coming so close to death so many times.  It was literally a now or never. If something happened to me, at least I died trying. The sisteraposs interview - which marks the first time any of the children have been identied - includes previously unseen bodycam footage of the moment police raided the Turpin household. Her  call was previously released, with Jordan heard telling operators the children lived in filth and would only be allowed to bathe once a year.When Jordan climbed out of the window of the family home to alert the authorities to their hellish existence, the eldest of the Turpinaposs children was  years old.  When police arrived to investigate Jordanaposs  call claiming her  siblings had been kept captive and abused, they found the group so malnourished they did not at first realise some of the brothers and sisters were adults. Some of the siblings were found bound to their beds and furniture by chains and padlocks - telling police they were “starving.” Jordan said of the abuse: Mother, she choked me and I thought I was going to die. Her sister - who has remained unnamed in the episode preview - said: The only word I can think to call it is hell.  In , David and Louise Turpin were jailed for  years to le over  counts each of torture, dependent adult abuse, child endangerment and  imprisonment. David Turpin, , an engineer, and housewe Louise, , had managed to cover up their childrenaposs miserable living situation for years by home-schooling them, when in reality they were sometimes chaining them up for one to two months and only freeing them to brush their teeth or use the bathroom. A court heard details of how some of the children claimed to have not bathed in a year, how their parents would bake them food and bring them toys - but they were not allowed to touch them.  They were stopped from using the toilet. None had seen a dentist. Most had little to no schooling, and the -year-old who rang  didnapost know what medication was. They never ate breakfast and subsisted on a paltry diet with no breakfast, and aposmealsapos of peanut butter, bologna, a frozen burrito or chips for lunch and dinner. The police took the children into protective custody after they were found living in the horric conditions last January. The Turpins cried as their children addressed the courtroom before their parents were put behind bars. My parents took my whole le from me, now I’m taking my le back, one of the coupleaposs daughters said.  “Le may have been bad, but it made me strong. I saw my dad change my mum, they almost changed me. I’m a fighter. I’m strong.” An adult son said he still loves his parents, but recounted years of horric abuse. I cannot describe in words what me and my siblings went through, he said in a statement. Sometimes, I still have nightmares about what happened, like my sibling being chained up and beaten. I love my parents and have forgiven them for all of the things that they have done to us.  I have learned so much and become very independent. I live in an apartment and go to a nearby college. I am getting a bacheloraposs degree in software engineering, and after I get my bacheloraposs degree Iaposm going to get a job as a software engineer and go to school part-time to get my masteraposs degree. news weird-news adorable-golden-retriever-pup-compared-"TikTok Golden Retriever puppy spends first day at dog daycareByCatherine Swan:,  Nov | commentsWith many of us ing to work in offices, it can be particularly tough for dogs who have become used to having their owners around the house.But one owner has found the perfect solution for her pups, as shown in a heart-melting TikTok video of a golden retriever’s first day at dog day care. The clip posted by@thegoodboyarchiefollows adorable puppy Ivy on her big day.In the dog equivalent of her first day at school, Ivy even brings her own packed lunch - a bag of kibble with her name on it. “I hope they like me,” the video caption reads as Ivy arrives at the care facility, Pampered Pets in Fort Wayne, Indiana, with her big brother Archie leading the way to the front door. Ivy seems uncertain about her destination at first - she scratches at the door as her owner leaves, before cuddling into fellow golden retriever Archie for comfort. But the confident pup soon leaves all her worries behind, as the next clip shows her lying sprawled out on her back in the middle of the yard as the other dogs snf around her. “This is so much fun!” the video caption reads as the pup bounds around the yard, enjoying playtime with her new friends and even having a dip in a paddling pool.This week our sister site TeamDogs is hosting its first ever Hero Dogs Week, supported by Everypaw Pet Insurance.Aiming to shine a light on the UK’s incredible furry friends, this week-long celebration will spotlight the everyday heroes who’ve gone above and beyond to help their humans – but we need your help finding them. So, whether your pup is an emotional support animal who supports your mental health on a daily basis, therapy dog who brings joy to hospital patients, or just a bundle of love and fluff who gets the whole family grinning on rainy days, send in your photos and stories so we can share the love. To enter your hero dog, simply post your dog’s photo and story on the TeamDogs Pics of dogs page. Her owner comes to pick her up at the end of the day and Ivy is then shown fast asleep when she gets home, worn out from her big adventure. The precious pup’s first day has more than two million views on TikTok, with many people commenting on Ivy’s popularity at the daycare. “Ivy AKA Marilyn Monroe,” one person said. “She had all the dogs flocking to her.” “Ivy is obviously the main character,” another added. Others praised the idea of a care facility that caters specially to dogs. “Dog daycare is genius,” one TikTok user said. “We do have to work. Better than leaving them alone all day.”But for pups at home, there are ways to keep themselves entertained - likethis golden retrieverwho can’t tear his eyes away from The Lion King.Nobu can be seen wagging his tail as he sits engrossed in his favourite Disney film, proving that movie night isn’t just a pastime for humans. title: bartender left creeped out mans
story: Bartender left creeped out by mans odd request after he orders drink from herIt might seem like a glamorous job, but bartending has lots of downsides, as one woman showed when she captured a very awkward request from a customer on cameraThe video went viral Image: chickfillkayyy TiktokByRosaleen FentonAudience Writer:,  Nov | commentsWorking as a bartender is a ied job, where you have no idea what to expect every sht. Of course, any hospitality job can be tough, with customers ranging from a total delight to absolute nightmare. So it doesnapost help when you add booze into the equation.On TikTok, one woman went viral after sharing unsettling footage of her dealing with a male customer who had a rather unusual request. Kayla Elick went viral after sharing the incident on TikTok on her account @chickfillkayyy, which occurred at  a.m. during a morning sht.The bartender explained that she started filming as she was feeling uncomfortable and there was nobody  working at the bar besides me.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here In it, the unknown customer suddenly inquires.Can I see your feet just once  My what  Kayla responds. Your feet, he repeats. My feet  she replies confusedly, before jokily showing them her left foot and shooting a look towards the camera. At that point, another man interjects to say: No, those are shoes.But, understandably, the bartender refuses to follow the request, as she firmly tells them Iaposm not pulling out my feet.. The woman shared the clip of their unpleasant encounter to TikTok, where it has racked up nearly four million views. The encounter left many reeling at the customeraposs creepy attempt to speak to her. One viewer advised: This may pay the bills but find a job where it pays you well and youaposre in a better environment girl. Another commented: I worked at a bar for two weeks when I was  and it was extremely uncomfortable. A third wrote: am   Jesus, too early for that. Iaposm so sorry you have to go through that. title: child genius reborn martian sent
story: Child genius is reborn Martian sent to warn us of nuclear apocalypseBoriska Kipriyanovich has demonstrated a remarkable grasp of scientic and astronomical concepts and said he knows so much because in a previous le he lived on MarsBoriska claims to be a martian reborn as a human Image: mirrorByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments A child genius claims to be an alien from Mars that was reincarnated in human form after his species were wiped out in nuclear conflict - and he wants to warn us of the battle.Boriska Kipriyanovich, now , has been baffling experts since they learned of him in , and now a video of his ominous claims has sparked fresh panic online. From an early age, he has been telling people about his previous le on Mars - where he lived among an alien civilisation that was ravaged by war and then a nuclear catastrophe. Boriska said he was a pilot among the aliens, and that he travelled to earth in  and was then aposrebornapos as a human child - and wants to warn us of an upcoming battle. What do you think about Boriskaaposs claims  Let us know in the comments...Boriska, who prefers to be addressed as aposIndigo Childapos, said that there are other survivors from his home planet - who escaped the apocalypse by building shelters. He said that his kind are seven feet tall, breath carbon dioxide, and many are immortal and stop ageing at . He said: I remember that time when I was  or  years old. The Martians were waging wars all the time so I would often have to participate in air raids with a friend of mine. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. We could travel in time and space flying in round spaceships, but we would observe le on Earth on triangular aircraft. Martian spaceships are very complicated. Boriska said that the human race has much more knowledge to unlock, and the Great Sphinx in Egypt holds the key. The human le will change when the Sphinx is opened, it has an opening mechanism somewhere behind the ear I do not remember exactly, claims Boriska. The outlandish claims have sparked endless discussion on conspiracy theory websites. Boriska is said to have displayed much higher than average intelligence from young age and was reading, writing and speaking by just  months. He first became famous in Russia after holding adults spellbound with his tales of his former le on Mars during a camping trip aged seven.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it.
